name: Thermal Shock
description: Sudden rapid change in temperature can cause immense stress on a mech’s armor platings, often causing it to become brittle and crack. Using an advanced laser cooling array, SSC offers a unique avenue to utilize this effect on the battlefield.

actions.detail: Choose an enemy within Range 10 that currently has Burn. The enemy clears all Burn, take kinetic damage equal to Burn cleared, and become Shredded until the end of your next turn

name: Catalyst Charges
description: Smith-Shimano’s BELLA CIAO workshop newest product, the Catalyst Charges, contains a miniature aerosol deployment system for hyper-reactive chemicals, saturating the atmosphere with the compound in a single moment. Inert by themselves, the chemical readily reacts to outside effects, magnifying their potency.

deployables.name: Catalyst Mine
deployables.detail: When detonated, all enemy mechs within Burst 3 of the mine must succeed on an Agility check or be Slowed and Impaired until the end of their next turn. On a successful check, they are only Impaired.

name: Moths to a Flame
description: Hyperfixation on light and heat is a common instinctual behavior in many insects. Through careful study of the underlying cause, the same effect can be applied onto and temporarily overrides a mech’s subjectivity, driving them to move towards the nearest flame, heedless of reason or personal safety.

actions.name: Activate Moths to a Flame
actions.detail:
Choose a Blast 3 area within your Sensor Range. All characters within must succeed on a Systems Save or involuntarily move a distance equal to their speed towards the nearest other target with Burn, taking the most direct path possible. On a successful Save, move half the distance. This movement ignores Engagement but triggers Reactions.
If there are no other targets with Burn, this action has no effect.

name: Ring of Fire
description: Though often employed against soft targets, SSC consider such usage of pyroclastic weaponry uncouth and barbaric, and instead divest their attention to the usage of flame weaponries as an area denial system. The Ring of Fire is a two stage mechanism designed to produce long lasting flames to coral enemies where the user wants. First, a spray of hyper-reactant catalyst breaks down terrain material into aerosolized base components, which are oftentimes flammable gasses and fuels. A second stage focused laser provides the spark to turn the nebulous cloud into a raging ring of fire.

actions.name: Activate Ring of Fire
actions.detail:
Create a Line 5 Height 1 line in any direction, with the origin point within range 3 of you. The line lasts until the end of the scene or until a new line is created. This doesn’t block line of sight and is considered Soft Cover.
Enemies that move through the line or end their turn within it take Burn 1. Enemies moving through the line must make an Engineering check or have their movement be stopped within the line. This can only trigger once per turn for each enemy.
Allied attacks that trace line of sight through the Line gain 1 Burn bonus damage.

name: Total Shutdown
effect: When this mech Stuns an enemy, while Stunned the enemy also automatically fails all Engineering and System Checks and Saves and has their E-Defense reduced to 5.
description: Capitalizing on the system vulnerability caused by massive physical trauma, the Total Shutdown system adds electronic attack on top, causing momentary disruption of a vulnerable mech’s operating system and reactor.

name: BREACH Protocol
description: In accordance with IPS-N research and development into combat in a boarding situation, BREACH is a series of upgrades mounted on a mech’s motors and servos, providing a burst of speed at the cost of maneuverability, perfect for maneuvering down a ship’s narrow but straight hallways to deliver the mech into the thick of fighting.

actions.name: Activate BREACH Protocol
actions.detail: You gain +1 Speed until the start of your next turn. All movement and boosts you make until the start of your next turn must spend all movement points and be in a straight line, stopping when obstructed by terrain.

name: LEGION-Class COMP/CON
effect: Your mech gains the AI property and the following Quick Tech Option. LEGION is not a full NHP and as such, cannot Cascade.
description: Derived from ship-class CENTURION-Class Comp/Con, LEGION brings the CENTURION knack for organizing battlefield movement to terrestrial conflict, coordinating a mech’s movement with unparalleled efficiency and accuracy. As a newer COMP/CON model, LEGION is preferred over UNCLE for its stability, though some pilots do confess to occasionally missing the older COMP/CON quirks.

At the end of your next turn, the target takes all the recorded damage as AP energy damage that cannot be reduced in any way.

effect: Gain the AI property and the following Protocol:
description:
Manifested during a 100-man simulated brawl on the moon Eyalet-a where one contestant used a Heruka instead of the Blue Lotus as agreed upon, RAVANA is born in battle with a thirst for conflict. Initially mis-labeled as a Sehkmet defective clone, Ravana instead shows remarkable restraint despite its apparent lust for battle, appearing collected and focused both on and off the battlefield. It views conflict as a means to an end, using battle to strengthen itself and test its skills to forever hone its technique, both within physical and digital space, with the aim of becoming the most complete warrior possible.

description: An array of super magnets arranged such that when a current is triggered, it can send almost anything flying at lethal speed. Though often employed in rail and gauss weapons, such an array can also be installed independently, allowing the pilot freedom to choose what shall be sent downrange at supersonic speed at any given time.

description: An upgrade pack for a mech’s electronic defense compartments, containing both a signal upgrade and a software update, allowing for more versatile use of the original digital spoofing system. Beyond merely scrambling guided weaponry, the electronic defense system can tackle the problem at the source, spoofing a mech’s visual feed and scanner data to subtly modify the position of the user’s mech, causing their aim to go astray.

The CHANG’E-Class NHP provides advanced multi-wavelength control and co-pilot functions, capable of bending most wavelengths of electromagnetic waves, even light itself, in order to protect and hide its pilots from most forms of harm.
CHANG’E clones are known to be very protective and supportive of its pilots, looking after them both physically and mentally, offering encouragement and health evaluation at will. Pilots are reminded to check the CHANG’E control privilege often, as this usually benevolent trait can sometime veers into overprotectiveness, as CHANG’E sometime takes control of the mech unprompted to protect pilots from what the pilot would consider acceptable risk, or otherwise disobey pilot orders “for their own good”.

As a Quick Action, deploy this drone onto an adjacent free space.
Salvager drones move independently on your turn. It carries one repair charge
Once per turn, it may choose one of the following actions:

Untrained, but receptive, they utilize dense Combat Data obtained with Horus assistance and uploaded into the mech's systems. Drawing from its vast scenarios, a mech installed with these data packets can aid inexperienced users in split-second decision making and capitalizing on opportunity when it presents itself

Discarded as far away as possible from human dwelling, these barrels of highly poisonous and corrosive fluids are rarely, if ever, checked up on, and obtaining them is as simple as showing up and loading them onto a vehicle. Loaded into shells with a small charge to ensures optimal dispersal, these makeshift chemical weapons can eat through armor and flesh alike.

name: Kingslayer
description: Incursions by Rat King armed rebels are marked by an uncanny degree of coordination. Thousands of robots and drones flow out of sewer and scrapyards like water, washing away all that it can and going around that which it can’t, covering each other's flanks, overwhelming technologically superior forces with deft use of focus fire. Those who would look down upon a simple cleaner bot armed with a small pipe gun have never had to face a hundred of them all firing in their direction.

actions.name: Divided They Fall
actions.detail: Choose a hostile character within your Sensors. Each of your Drones within Range 5 of it may make a ranged attack using your Grit against that target, dealing 1 kinetic damage.

effect:
1/round you may use this system to swap one of your equipped Main/Aux ranged weapons to any one of the following special ammunition types. This effect persists until the end of the scene, until you spend a quick action to swap that weapon to a different ammunition type, or until you revert a weapon to its normal state as a protocol. Only one special ammunition type can be used on a weapon at a time.
  • Blue Screen Round: The weapon deals half damage and Burn. Oh hit, the enemy must succeed on a Systems check or be Impaired until the end of your next turn.
  • Quick-Attach Signal Receiver: The weapon deals half damage and Burn. On hit, the target is marked with a Signal Tracking token. When declaring a tech attack, you or an allied mech may spend this token to make the marked enemy a valid target, regardless of sensors or line of sight.
  • Full-Spectrum Target Lock: The weapon gains Inaccurate. Against targets in the Danger Zone, replace Inaccurate with Accurate, and gain Smart and Seeking.

name: VELES-Class NHP
effect: Your mech gains the AI property and the Disrupt Equilibrium Full Tech action.
description:
Harrison Armory VELES is the result of a failed integration of an NHP into the Think Tank. Though displaying an unrivaled computational prowess and a thirst for knowledge, the NHP proves to be uncooperative when introduced to the choir of the Think Tank, frequently getting into arguments and overriding other members' commands. [HEY] This effect only worsens as VELES is given unfettered access to the Omninet, driving its superiority complex to unacceptable parameters. Excised from the Think Tank, VELES was instead transferred to Harrison Armory's Electronic Warfare Department, where it found new life putting its [LISTEN TO ME] raw power and deep well of knowledge to use in destroying other mech's fragile computing systems.
Though still arrogant with a dismissive know-it-all attitude, VELES clones display a remarkably more cooperative attitude towards pilots than other NHPs. [DON'T LISTEN TO THEM, WHAT DO THEY KNOW?] It is theorized that this is due to it not seeing humans as adversarial equals, but as lesser beings that cannot be blamed for our actions due to our lack of understanding and mental capacity [MEAT BAGS IN MEAT SPACE! THEY HAVE EYES BUT DO NOT SEE!], needing VELES's guidance and protection. Researchers compared this perception to that of a destructive but ultimately endearing pet. This, however, does not stop said guidance from being cloaked in dripping sarcasm and condescension. [DON'T QUESTION IT! JUST DO WHAT I TELL YOU TO DO, OKAY BUDDY? OKAY? OKAY! GOOD BOY!]

Data streaming out of the scanner, spilling over, dripping off the podium to form puddles on the smooth stone floor. I would like to say that we were controlled, that something had taken hold of us, but the truth is that we wanted to see it. We walked into the abyss of our own accord. We needed to know.”

description:
Borne as a fork of prime Asura, Thor was an early attempt at curbing Asura’s fatal tendency to overclock a mech’s action speed by restricting what subroutines it has access to. While the initial Asura clones were then refined to the current, safe-for-human-pilots Asura-class NHPs of today, Thor yielded results that deemed it a worthy avenue to explore. By restricting subroutines, Thor was able to perform only actions that does not directly impact a pilot’s health, with the same blinding speed as the original Asura. Pushing a mech’s servos to its limit, and sometime beyond, Thor was able to fire colossal siege weapons with the same ease that it handled a standard Armory Assault Rifle, and swing superheavy class melee weapons using a single arm.
Brash and prideful, Thor clones are noted for their glory seeking behavior, seeking to perform ever greater feats of strength and engineering to the adoring eyes of onlookers. While the effect on morale amongst legionaries is undeniable, pilots are strongly advised to keep a clear head against Thor’s eager urging, for martyrdom is considered the greatest glory one might seek.

description: IPS-N's Targeting Beacon interfaces with most standard IPS-N targeting systems, providing real time battlefield information for allies to adjust their targeting parameters. Utilizing its parent mech as an intermediary, the targeting beacon can interface with air support or even orbital support systems, designating zones of fire for artillery bombardment.

Hostile characters at least partially in the zone make all Checks and Saves at +2 Difficulty. Only one beacon may be deployed at once, and creating a new beacon destroys the old one

description:
Cliodhna was born during SSC’s research into non-space, specifically, research into what happens when two objects occupy the same location in both space and non-space and their interactions when breaching the dimensional barrier. Unable to produce reliable results through manual testing, researchers resorted to constructing a choir of 3 NHPs to run endless simulations of the scenario, and then wrapping the facility in a relativistic field in order to compress the time needed. Also unable to produce consistent results, the NHP-choir became increasingly agitated and unstable as they repeated experiments and simulations endlessly to no avail, and a fourth NHP manifested within the system, breaking the relativistic bubble and causing the complete destruction of the facility before being contained and isolated for further research.
Now shackled, the newly created NHP, designated Cliodhna, is noted for its capability for manipulating the fabric of spaces and the barrier between dimensions, as first demonstrated by forcefully breaking through the relativistic field. A markedly unstable NHP, Cliodhna exhibits wild mood swings, flipping from deliberating ennui to inconsolable rage seemingly at a moment’s notice, straining the very limits of shackling. Exhibiting a higher than average rate of cascading, Cliodhna is not available for conventional requisition, and its true origin is a closely guarded secret, even from Union’s inspectors.

name: SVAROG-Class NHP
description:
Usually laid back and calm, the SVAROG-Class NHP has an obsession with cataloging parts and putting them into correctly labeled places. Originally intended for usage in salvaging operations as an administrative unit, its transition to combat usage has lent itself to a tendency to interrupt combat feeds with its own stream of data about enemy structural readings, armor metallurgical composition, ship history and any other trivia it dredges up from the Omni-net.
Although very efficient at its task and displaying phenomenal parallel-track data processing, once SVAROG starts going it is difficult to stop it as it hyper-focuses on the task at hand to the detriment of all other factors. IPS-N has noted that SVAROG clones have a higher than average cascade rate. Inquiries into the matter has revealed that this is not due to anything inherent to the NHP itself, but due to administrators and pilots being careless around SVAROG due to its perceived harmlessness and quirky personality, as well as the fact that a near-cascade SVAROG ends up doing what it's supposed to be doing anyway, obsessively and of its own accord.
